text: This is a sample app demonstrating possibilities of the chips library.
The text you read right now is stored in assets/notes.json file. It goes over most interesting parts of this app.
You can click on each item on this list and go into edit mode. There you can modify contents of the selected item, preview, save your changes and go back.
ChipsTextView text layout can be rendered in a background thread, thanks to that we can reduce time spent in onBindView from up to 100ms down to 4ms and dramatically improve smoothness of scrolling.
You can click on each item on this list and go into edit mode. There you can modify contents of the selected item and go back.
Navigation in this app is implemented using the flow library. Mortar manages scopes of each screen and then dependencies are injected using Dagger2.
